bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, December 19, 1923

div1.p: Read sends Carter letters received from Deeks regarding a fatal case of malaria on board ship.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, December 19, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
December 19, 1923
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Under date of November 6, 1923, Doctor Elmendorf
called our attention to the case of fatal malaria on board
the “Saramacca” proceeding from Puerto Barrios, reported
in the Public Health Reports of October fifth. I wrote
Doctor Deeks asking if he had further data concerning
this case. For your information, I enclose a copy of
his reply and of the reports enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3 he submitted.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FMR:EP E
